section.title: Introduction
section.p: Mingle gives you many options for updating cards, both individually and in bulk.

section.title: Updating individual cards
section.p: First find and open the card you want to update.

screenshot.caption: Card view page - updating an individual card

subsection.title: Posting Murmurs
subsection.p: When you open an individual card, you can post Murmurs.

subsection.title: Updating the card description
subsection.p: If you don't yet have a card description, Mingle displays an "Add description" link, which you can click to include a card description. Otherwise click the "Edit" button to open the card and update an existing description.

Mingle will always return you to the latest version of the description when you open it to edit. From here you can format the description, add links and attach graphics and documents. Learn more about creating and formatting card content using Mingle's rich text editor.

subsection.title: Updating tags
subsection.p: Click the Add tags link to apply new tags. Or if there are existing tags, you can click the Edit tags link to add or remove tags. You can quickly remove a tag by clicking on the cross next to the tag. See Working with tags for details.

subsection.title: Updating checklists
subsection.p: Click the plus icon next to Checklists to create a new checklist item. Hover over the checklist item to rearrange the order. You can view the completed items when at least one item has been checked off by clicking on "Show completed items." To remove a checklist item, simply click the "x" next to the item.

subsection.title: Applying transitions
subsection.p: If a card matches the card property values in a transition, one or more transition links display on the card (in the example above, there is a transition called Start User Story). Click the transition link to update the card's status. See Using transitions for details.

subsection.title: Updating card properties
subsection.p:
You can either update a card property by selecting an existing value or by creating a new value. Depending on the property type, you will be presented with the allowable values or asked to type in a new value. To select an existing value for a card property, you can either click on a value that is presented to you or begin to type in a keyword. The latter is helpful if a card property has a long value list because as you type the keyword only the values that match the entered keyword will be presented.
From here you can create new card property values for managed list properties by selecting the New value... link if the property is unlocked.

subsection.title: Add a card to a tree
subsection.p: You can add a card to a tree or change it's parent in the tree by assigning a parent card id to a relationship property. These properties are displayed in a box with the name of the corresponding card tree as a title.

section.title: Updating cards in bulk
section.p: When viewing cards in Mingle's List view, you can select multiple cards and perform bulk actions on them. See Updating cards in bulk for details.
